item.title: Richard add a quote by Johann wolfgang von Goethe
item.description: "A person hears only what they understand." -- Johann wolfgang von Goethe

item.title: Richard add a quote by Johann Wolfgang von Goethe
item.description: "As soon as you trust yourself, you will know how to live." -- Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

item.title: Richard add a quote by Eckhart Tolle
item.description: "Life is the dancer and you are the dance." -- Eckhart Tolle

item.title: Richard add a quote by e.e. cummings
item.description: "For whatever we lose (like a you or a me), It's always our self we find in the sea." -- e.e. cummings

item.title: Richard add a quote by Joan Didion
item.description: "Character — the willingness to accept responsibility for one's own life — is the source from which self-respect springs." -- Joan Didion

item.title: Richard add a quote by Emily Bronte
item.description: "Terror made me cruel . . ." -- Emily Bronte

item.title: Richard add a quote by Hermann Hesse
item.description: "You must find your dream...but no dream lasts forever, each dream is followed by another, and one should not cling to any particular dream." -- Hermann Hesse

item.title: Richard add a quote by Quentin Crisp
item.description: "It's been agony but I couldn't have done it any other way." -- Quentin Crisp

item.title: Richard add a quote by Eckhart Tolle
item.description: "Give up defining yourself - to yourself or to others. You won't die. You will come to life. And don't be concerned with how others define you. When they define you, they are limiting themselves, so it's their problem. Whenever you interact with people, don't be there primarily as a function or a role, but as the field of conscious Presence. You can only lose something that you have, but you cannot lose something that you are." -- Eckhart Tolle

item.title: Richard add a quote by Hermann Hesse
item.description: "One never reaches home,' she said. 'But where paths that have an affinity for each other intersect, the whole world looks like home, for a time." -- Hermann Hesse

item.title: Richard add a quote by Joan Didion
item.description: "That was the year, my twenty-eighth, when I was discovering that not all of the promises would be kept, that some things are in fact irrevocable and that it had counted after all, every evasion and every procrastination, every mistake, every word, all of it." -- Joan Didion

item.title: Richard add a quote by Charlotte Bronte
item.description: "Conventionality is not morality." -- Charlotte Bronte

item.title: Richard add a quote by Hermann Hesse
item.description: "In eternity there is no time, only an instant long enough for a joke." -- Hermann Hesse

item.title: Richard add a quote by Susan Sontag
item.description: "All struggle, all resistance is -- must be -- concrete. And all struggle has a global resonance. If not here, then there. If not now, then soon. Elsewhere as well as here." -- Susan Sontag

item.title: Richard add a quote by Hermann Hesse
item.description: "There is no reality except the one contained within us. That is why so many people live such an unreal life. They take the images outside of them for reality and never allow the world within to assert itself." -- Hermann Hesse

item.title: Richard add a quote by Hermann Hesse
item.description: "A soul that is ruined in the bud will frequently return to the springtime of its beginning and its promise-filled childhood, as though it could discover new hopes there and retie the broken threads of life. The shoots grow rapidly and eagerly, but it is only a sham life that will never be a genuine tree." -- Hermann Hesse

item.title: Richard add a quote by Susan Sontag
item.description: "The likelihood that your acts of resistance cannot stop the injustice does not exempt you from acting in what you sincerely and reflectively hold to be the best interests of your community." -- Susan Sontag

item.title: Richard add a quote by Joan Didion
item.description: "I think we are well advised to keep on nodding terms with the people we used to be, whether we find them attractive company or not. Otherwise they turn up unannounced and surprise us, come hammering on the mind's door at 4 a.m. of a bad night and demand to know who deserted them, who betrayed them, who is going to make amends." -- Joan Didion

item.title: Richard add a quote by Marilyn Monroe
item.description: "Imperfection is beauty, madness is genius and it's better to be absolutely ridiculous than absolutely boring." -- Marilyn Monroe

item.title: Richard add a quote by Eckhart Tolle
item.description: "Don't let a mad world tell you that success is anything other than a successful present moment." -- Eckhart Tolle

item.title: Richard add a quote by Hermann Hesse
item.description: "Without words, without writing and without books there would be no history, there could be no concept of humanity." -- Hermann Hesse

item.title: Richard add a quote by Hermann Hesse
item.description: "Words do not express thoughts very well. They always become a little different immediately after they are expressed, a little distorted, a little foolish." -- Hermann Hesse

item.title: Richard add a quote by Hermann Hesse
item.description: "The bourgeois prefers comfort to pleasure, convenience to liberty, and a pleasant temperature to the deathly inner consuming fire" -- Hermann Hesse

item.title: Richard add a quote by Hermann Hesse
item.description: "Each man's life represents a road toward himself, an attempt at such a road, the intimation of a path. No man has ever been entirely and completely himself." -- Hermann Hesse

item.title: Richard add a quote by Hermann Hesse
item.description: "I wanted only to live in accord with the promptings which came from my true self. Why was that so very difficult?" -- Hermann Hesse

item.title: Richard add a quote by Hermann Hesse
item.description: "I shall no longer be instructed by the Yoga Veda or the Aharva Veda, or the ascetics, or any other doctrine whatsoever. I shall learn from myself, be a pupil of myself; I shall get to know myself, the mystery of Siddhartha." He looked around as if he were seeing the world for the first time." -- Hermann Hesse

item.title: Richard add a quote by Hermann Hesse
item.description: "Every man is more than just himself; he also represents the unique, the very special and always significant and remarkable point at which the world's phenomena intersect, only once in this way, and never again. That is why every man's story is important, eternal, sacred; that is why every man, as long as he lives and fulfills the will of nature, is wondrous, and worthy of consideration. In each individual the spirit has become flesh, in each man the creation suffers, within each one a redeemer is nailed to the cross." -- Hermann Hesse

item.title: Richard add a quote by Hermann Hesse
item.description: "You are only afraid if you are not in harmony with yourself. People are afraid because they have never owned up to themselves. A whole society composed of men afraid of the unknown within them!" -- Hermann Hesse

item.title: Richard add a quote by Hermann Hesse
item.description: "One must find the source within one's own Self, one must possess it. Everything else was seeking -- a detour, an error." -- Hermann Hesse

item.title: Richard add a quote by Hermann Hesse
item.description: "You should never be afraid of people... such fear can destroy us completely. You've simply got to get rid of it, if you want to turn into someone decent. You understand that, don't you?" -- Hermann Hesse
